alert.note: Alert for Coke; Sterling (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 1:40PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Coke, Sterling and southwestern Nolan Counties through 230 PM CST... At 140 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles northwest of Sterling City, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sterling City, Silver, Broome and Us-87 Near The Coke- Tom Green County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for west central Texas.
